text.p: Here are highlights from Polish newspapers this morning.
FRONT PAGE POLITICAL NEWS
RZECZPOSPOLITA

- Poland's Prime Minister Wlodzimierz Cimoszewicz denied that the recent dismissal of the chief of the general staff, Tadeusz Wilecki, was politically motivated and said such accusations were compromising and lacking seriousness.
- Russia's Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin has ordered the release of the Polish Aquarius fishing trawler which was arrested on February 26 in the Sea of Okhotsk for the lack of a fishing permit.
ECONOMIC AND MARKET NEWS
RZECZPOSPOLITA
- Poland's government has guaranteed Bank Handlowy and bank PKO BP a credit line for the construction of a new Warsaw University library currently underway.
- Poland's PZU and Warta major insurance firms will introduce a unified auto damage calculation sheet for their loss assessors and repair garages, the companies said.
- The Szczecin-based Parnica shipyard has launched a 27.8 metre long and 5.1 metre wide fishing trawler for a Scottish contractor.
- The Odratrans river shipping firm has recently started its 1997 shipment season on the Oder river with a barge transport of metallic ores to Wroclaw, southwestern Poland.
- Around 70 percent of roads in Warsaw need maintenance and modernisation work.
The city's road maintenace firm (MPRD) requires up to 300 million zlotys but has only about 30 percent of the funds needed, MPRD said.
- The Szczecin shipyard is planning to take a controlling stake in the Gdynia shipyard.
Other investors are intersted as well but no companies were officially named.
Gdynia shipyard shareholders want to increase the yard's share capital through a C-series share issue worth from 45 million to 150.8 million zlotys.
- Six foreign companies are ready to join the Krakow-based Huta Sedzimira steel mill as strategic investors, the mill's general director Jerzy Knapik said.

- Impexmetal foreign trade firm, which now holds a controlling stake in the Skawina aluminium works, has granted a social package guaranteeing employees three year employment and six month pay in case of redundancies.
NOWA EUROPA
- The U.S.'s Microsoft software maker is not planning to acquire shares in the the listed Optimus computer maker, Microsoft representative Sandy Duncan said.

- Poland's inflation in 1997 will reach 14 percent and its current account deficit will reach $14 billion, exceeding the government's forecast for 1996-1998 by $10 billion, the National Chamber of Commerce's (KIG) private sector and democracy research institute said.
- Poland's furniture, vehicle and household durable sales grew in February, the Central Statistical Office (GUS) said.
- Germany's VEW AG energy concern is planning to construct underground gas storage tanks in Poland, the concern's president Fritz Ziegler said.
GAZETA WYBORCZA
- Polish teenage buyers spend up to 2.3 billion zlotys every year and participate in family purchasing decisions, a recent report by the Getar IRWiK market research firm said.
ZYCIE
- The Polish advertising industry has founded an advertising council to monitor ethical norms in the advertising business and solve conflicts between advertising agencies and their customers.
PARKIET

- Poland's banking association (ZBP) wants the new banking law to facilitate operations by Polish banks and decrease its burdens to enhance competitiveness of local fiancial institutions facing competiton from Western banks.
-- Warsaw Newsroom +48 22 653 9700
